byline.contributor: David M. Herszenhorn contributed reporting from Washington.

abstract: United States, Japan and 10 other Pacific Rim nations, after years of negotiations, attain final agreement on Trans-Pacific Partnership, biggest regional trade pact in history; deal faces months of wrangling in Congress, and could bring one of the toughest fights Pres Obama will face in his final year in the White House.
lead_paragraph: Securing approval from Congress for the deal between the United States and 11 Pacific Rim nations could be the toughest fight President Obama faces in his final year in office.

headline.main: Trans-Pacific Partnership Is Reached, but Faces Scrutiny in Congress
headline.print_headline: 11 Pacific Nations and U.S. Endorse Giant Trade Pact

snippet: Securing approval from Congress for the deal between the United States and 11 Pacific Rim nations could be the toughest fight President Obama faces in his final year in office.
